title: Tinobtc
author: Tinobtc
content: I am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: This is my first time in life actually seeing someone not happy to get a spam email from a news/media company. I would never subscribe for an email like this as all the information is real time and Twitter/X is the right place if you follow right accounts. Coming back to your actual problem, maybe check your spam folders? People like me report them as a spam and may cause issues to people like you. No offense though.

comments.author: Hamza2424
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 19, 2024, 04:58:19 PMThis is my first time in life actually seeing someone not happy to get a spam email from a news/media company. I would never subscribe for an email like this as all the information is real time and Twitter/X is the right place if you follow right accounts. Coming back to your actual problem, maybe check your spam folders? People like me report them as a spam and may cause issues to people like you. No offense though.Hmm, He's obsessed with Bitcoin and it is obvious for him to ask about such things to start a discussion on it because he made some decent efforts to create an account and ask this question. Thour you should not hurt the emotions of the subscribers by reporting the emails, please show some respect as these emails help's them a lot to stay updated haha (Just kidding as the forum is getting worse with the political topics in this section).I'm sure this topic is going to be deleted  .

comments.author: Pandorak
comments.body: Quote from: Tinobtc on September 19, 2024, 04:29:23 PMI am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?I'm not a subscriber to crypto newspapers, and this is no longer the time for that. All information is now fast-paced, even platforms are competing to publish, whoever gets the attention the fastest. So, if you mean a paid subscription, of course i wouldn't take it. Back to your problem, they have mainstream social media, maybe you can ask their social media representatives about your problem.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: Quote from: Tinobtc on September 19, 2024, 04:29:23 PMI am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?Do you actually cares, aren't you tired of their continues flooding of updates to you, maybe they only wanted you to take some rest because they resume back, and i hope it wasn't that you were the one who unsubscribe for tier mails unknowing to you, aside that, you may try to check if their other social media handles are still functioning with the news updates aside the ones coming form the mail, lastly, its not bad if you can also subscribe to another platform for continues spamming of mails.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Paper magazine? you mean you bought a physical mag from their store? just in case, are you sure it's not a courier issue? any tracking numbers you can see?About the email, try to see if you can whitelist their domain in your account. You could also use another email account to see if you'd encounter the same problem. I also agree about the social media suggestion.I'm not subscribed to them so can't do a personal input. Though of course, there's nothing wrong in using a medium you're more familiar or comfortable with, you do you.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Tinobtc on September 19, 2024, 04:29:23 PMI am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?I don't subscribe to the magazine, therefore I am not experiencing this issue. I didn't know there is a Bitcoin magazine that delivers physical paper magazines to their subscribers. If you can't reach them via emails then find an alternative channel through which you can reach them. Do they have social Media handles? Are they on Reddit? If none of this works , then chill for some time and try again. Good luck

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: I'm not a subscriber of Bitcoin Magazine so this isn't happening to me, but they have a quarterly issue, right? Their third issue is supposed to be released this month. So what do you mean they do not send the paper lately? You didn't receive your June issue? Or is the September issue released already?Anyway, if you're up to date with your payment and you're sure you missed an issue, you could contact them through Facebook or Twitter or Instagram if they're not replying via email. They're quite active actually. https://twitter.com/bitcoinmagazinehttps://www.facebook.com/BitcoinMagazinehttps://www.instagram.com/bitcoinmagazine/

comments.author: dificanovi
comments.body: Quote from: Tinobtc on September 19, 2024, 04:29:23 PMI am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?I have never had the same problem as you, because I do not want to subscribe to a Bitcoin magazine. Now everything is sophisticated and whatever information about Bitcoin we can get easily without having to subscribe to a Bitcoin magazine, in my opinion subscribing to a Bitcoin magazine is a waste of money.

comments.author: Agbamoni
comments.body: Quote from: Tinobtc on September 19, 2024, 04:29:23 PMI am a subscriber to Bitcoin Magazine, BTC Media, lately they do not send the paper magazine and do not answer emails. Is this happening to you too?Not everyone uses the Bitcoin Magazine to get updates on Bitcoin when there are social media, forums, and other sources to stay updated with the happenings on Bitcoin. Aside from that, it's not ideal to subscribe to their newspaper if you don't get their emails now then you should be happy because a lot of these sites have forgotten about the initial mission and vision of their platform and are not sending unwanted, misleading, and inaccurate information to subscribers.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Why don't you use the internet to finds news to get updated and if you want to learn more then this forum is good for you to learn like newbies who joined this forum not long ago and those who are once a newbie before. It's much better if you have more than one source of news or something like that when the other source doesn't give anything so the other source so you'll be able to read what you wanted to read about bitcoin news.

comments.author: syedakhlaque
comments.body: Today is the age of print media and electronic media. Print media and electronic media are needed for advertising any business and company. And without it no development and promotion is possible. Although Bitcoin Talk is a good platform negotiation for all communities of bitcoin. But the launch of Bitcoin Magazine in 2011 is a breakthrough and development. Through this, people will get the update of bitcoin and the awareness of the crypto market. A very good team is working for its improvement. And it is striving for the improvement of this magazine. And I think it should be appreciated by bitcoin communities

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 19, 2024, 04:58:19 PMThis is my first time in life actually seeing someone not happy to get a spam email from a news/media company. I would never subscribe for an email like this as all the information is real time and Twitter/X is the right place if you follow right accounts. Coming back to your actual problem, maybe check your spam folders? People like me report them as a spam and may cause issues to people like you. No offense though.OP has concerns about Bitcoin Magazine not sending physical copies, not Emails.  They probably paid for some magazines and did not receive them yet.

comments.author: adzino
comments.body: Quote from: ImThour on September 19, 2024, 04:58:19 PMThis is my first time in life actually seeing someone not happy to get a spam email from a news/media company. I would never subscribe for an email like this as all the information is real time and Twitter/X is the right place if you follow right accounts. Coming back to your actual problem, maybe check your spam folders? People like me report them as a spam and may cause issues to people like you. No offense though.I am pretty much sure if you read his post again you will understand that he is talking about physical magazines. He probably bought subscription to some weekly magazine and stopped receiving those. He tried emailing to them, but they aren't responding. I would be pissed too if I paid for something, never received it and the provider stops communicating. And even if everything is in real time, some people still like collecting and reading magazines. I don't see anything wrong with that. And why subscribe to newsletters or emails and then report them as a spam if you don't want to read them in the first place? Don't subscribe to those emails, and you wont be causing problems to people that are actually interested in newsletters. You wont be offending them too.

comments.author: Publictalk792
comments.body: Quote from: adzino on September 28, 2024, 04:01:14 AMI am pretty much sure if you read his post again you will understand that he is talking about physical magazines. He probably bought subscription to some weekly magazine and stopped receiving those. He tried emailing to them, but they aren't responding. I would be pissed too if I paid for something, never received it and the provider stops communicating. And even if everything is in real time, some people still like collecting and reading magazines. I don't see anything wrong with that. And why subscribe to newsletters or emails and then report them as a spam if you don't want to read them in the first place? Don't subscribe to those emails, and you wont be causing problems to people that are actually interested in newsletters. You wont be offending them too.I totally agree that someone should be angry if they paid for magazines but did not get them. Company should answer emails and help customers. Even with digital options people still like physical magazines for collecting and reading. Companies should respect that choice. Customers deserve to get what they paid for on time and get help when needed. Good service keeps customers happy and loyal. I hope he will get it soon.

comments.author: logfiles
comments.body: OP, are you talking about this?For Bitcoin magazine - https://store.bitcoinmagazine.com/collections/magazinesThere must be something wrong. At least if they are responsible, they should take some time to alert the subscribers on what's going on instead of being silent.

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: logfiles on September 28, 2024, 09:48:07 PMOP, are you talking about this?For Bitcoin magazine - https://store.bitcoinmagazine.com/collections/magazinesThere must be something wrong. At least if they are responsible, they should take some time to alert the subscribers on what's going on instead of being silent.I hate to bump this thread (especially since OP never bothered to make more than his original post), but this thread is totally relevant to a problem I'm having with bitcoinmagazine.com.  I've been collecting back issues recently, and right now they've been giving me the runaround.  I placed two orders at the end of December and when a couple of weeks went by without either order being processed, I e-mailed them.  The reply I got was that the holidays made everything busier, blah blah blah.  Then a couple more weeks later with my order status still showing "unprocessed" I e-mailed them again and my tone was far more stern.  I asked them for an estimate as to when they were going to ship everything (which totaled about $295)....and I got no response.Curious as to if anyone has had a shitty experience with them lately.  Speaking of shitty, most of the replies here are absolute garbage.  Maybe I should start up a scam accusation?

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on February 06, 2025, 04:49:53 PMMaybe I should start up a scam accusation?I'd say go for it as you've waited long enough. The no response after waiting for weeks is the nail in the coffin.And frankly, there's good chance this situation could spiral into the same pattern in the coming weeks, as well. So might as well exhaust your options if there's even a slightest chance of turning the situation around. Probably consider posting in other communities as well.

comments.author: Reatim
comments.body: Quote from: Hamza2424 on September 19, 2024, 05:09:54 PMI'm sure this topic is going to be deleted  .might be moved to the off topic section because bitcoin magazine is not actually affiliated with bitcoin, no? so it’s not like the news delivered is always credible and accurate but anyway as you can see from the replies it seems like not a lot of members have subscribed so maybe you should have checked their platform first before going here to the forum or maybe you unsubscribed accidentally

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: The Sceptical Chymist on February 06, 2025, 04:49:53 PM~  Speaking of shitty, most of the replies here are absolute garbage.  Maybe I should start up a scam accusation?I agree. Since you have already tried email a couple of times, maybe try calling them if they have a customer service number. Sometimes talking to someone directly can help resolve things.  If that doesnt work, and you are really not getting anywhere, it might be worth looking into other options like filing a complaint or dispute the charges with your credit card company.  A scam accusation would probably be justified as well.
